name: Death Denied
text: Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Takenuma was filled with a chorus of moans, shrieks, and wails. Some came from the living, some from the dying, and some, most horribly, from the dead.
Takenuma was filled with a chorus of moans, shrieks, and wails. Some came from the living, some from the dying, and some, most horribly, from the dead.
Takenuma was filled with a chorus of moans, shrieks, and wails. Some came from the living, some from the dying, and some, most horribly, from the dead.

name: Deathforge Shaman
text:
Multikicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Deathforge Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target player equal to twice the number of times it was kicked.

name: Death Frenzy
text: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn. Whenever a creature dies this turn, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: The crocodiles' putrid jaws swallow everything but the screams.

name: Deathgaze Cockatrice
text:
Flying
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor:
"Sometimes I come across a stone finger or foot and I know I'm in cockatrice territory."
—Rulak, bog guide

name: Deathgazer
text: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

editions.flavor: Your entire life passes before its eyes.
Your entire life passes before its eyes.

name: Death Grasp
text: Death Grasp deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain X life.

editions.flavor: Yawgmoth's greatest joy came from watching one hero defeat another.
Plate mail, the skin of the chest, the rib cage, the heart—all useless against the mage who can reach directly for the soul.
Plate mail, the skin of the chest, the rib cage, the heart—all useless against the mage who can reach directly for the soul.

name: Deathgreeter
text: Whenever another creature dies, you may gain 1 life.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
editions.flavor: "The bones of allies grant wisdom. The bones of enemies grant strength. The bones of dragons grant life eternal."
"The bones of allies grant wisdom. The bones of enemies grant strength. The bones of dragons grant life eternal."
"The bones of allies grant wisdom. The bones of enemies grant strength. The bones of dragons grant life eternal."

name: Deathgrip
text: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.

editions.flavor:
"Every forest is carpeted with the corpses of a thousand trees."
—Baron Sengir to Autumn Willow

name: Death-Hood Cobra
text:
{1}{G}: Death-Hood Cobra gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
{1}{G}: Death-Hood Cobra gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor:
"Size alone does not guarantee survival."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Deathknell Kami
text:
Flying
{2}: Deathknell Kami gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
Soulshift 1 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Deathlace
text: Target spell or permanent becomes black. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

name: Deathless Angel
text:
Flying
{W}{W}: Target creature gains indestructible until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"I should have died that day, but I suffered not a scratch. I awoke in a lake of blood, none of it apparently my own."
—The War Diaries

name: Deathless Behemoth
text:
Vigilance
Sacrifice two Eldrazi Scions: Return Deathless Behemoth from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: "Over and over it rose. Over and over we fell."—Ganda, Goma Fada deserter

name: Deathmark
text: Destroy target green or white creature.

editions.flavor: Even the noblest of intentions and strongest of wills inevitably crumble into dust.
There are few ways to escape the deathmark: bargaining with a demon, washing in the fabled waters of youth, and of course, death.

"Let the final vision of doom be etched upon their unblinking eyes."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

"I hope it's true that every snowflake is unique, because I never want to see one like this again. Now clean up that body."
—Thangbrand Gyrdsson, Kjeldoran patrol
There are few ways to escape the deathmark: bargaining with a demon, washing in the fabled waters of youth, and of course, death.

"I hope it's true that every snowflake is unique, because I never want to see one like this again. Now clean up that body."
—Thangbrand Gyrdsson, Kjeldoran patrol

name: Deathmark Prelate
text: {2}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a Zombie: Destroy target non-Zombie creature. It can't be regenerated. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: Death is a secret he is willing to share.

name: Death-Mask Duplicant
text:
Imprint — {1}: Exile target creature card from your graveyard.
As long as a card exiled with Death-Mask Duplicant has flying, Death-Mask Duplicant has flying. The same is true for fear, first strike, double strike, haste, landwalk, protection, and trample.

name: Deathmask Nezumi
text: As long as you have seven or more cards in hand, Deathmask Nezumi gets +2/+1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor:
"We had him cornered, we did . . . and, well, you know what they say about rats."
—Araba patrol survivor

name: Death Match
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, that creature's controller may have target creature of his or her choice get -3/-3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Cabal breeds many things for the pit fights, but it never breeds compassion.

name: Deathmist Raptor
text:
Deathtouch
Whenever a permanent you control is turned face up, you may return Deathmist Raptor from your graveyard to the battlefield face up or face down.
Megamorph {4}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

name: Death Mutation
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. Create X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.

name: Death of a Thousand Stings
text:
Target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have more cards in hand than each opponent, you may return Death of a Thousand Stings from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Death or Glory
text: Separate all creature cards in your graveyard into two piles. Exile the pile of an opponent's choice and return the other to the battlefield.

name: Deathpact Angel
text:
Flying
When Deathpact Angel dies, create a 1/1 white and black Cleric creature token. It has "{3}{W}{B}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice this creature: Return a card named Deathpact Angel from your graveyard to the battlefield."

name: Death Pit Offering
text:
When Death Pit Offering enters the battlefield, sacrifice all creatures you control.
Creatures you control get +2/+2.

editions.flavor:
"Kill them all and feed them to the new recruits."
—Crovax

"Kill them all and feed them to the new recruits."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

name: Death Pits of Rath
text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor:
"Neither could I forget what I had read of these pits—that the sudden extinction of life formed no part of their most horrible plan."
—Edgar Allan Poe,
"The Pit and the Pendulum"
As the sludge below began to shift and take shapes, Gerrard turned from the railing to Orim. "I suppose," he said, "it's a little too late for prayer, isn't it?"

"Neither could I forget what I had read of these pits—that the sudden extinction of life formed no part of their most horrible plan."

"The Pit and the Pendulum"

name: Death Pulse
text:
Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
Cycling {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Death Pulse, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.

name: Death Rattle
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Destroy target nongreen creature. It can't be regenerated.

name: Deathreap Ritual
text: Morbid — At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"All who set foot in Paliano are pawns in someone's play for power."
—Marchesa, the Black Rose

"All who set foot in Paliano are pawns in someone's play for power."
—Marchesa, the Black Rose

name: Deathrender
Deathrite Shaman
text:
{T}: Exile target land card from a graveyard. Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
{B}, {T}: Exile target instant or sorcery card from a graveyard. Each opponent loses 2 life.
{G}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. You gain 2 life.

name: Death's Approach
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -X/-X, where X is the number of creature cards in its controller's graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"It's cold in the grave, and the dead crave your warmth. Who are you to deny them?"
—Strava, Dimir mage

name: Death's Caress
text: Destroy target creature. If that creature was a Human, you gain life equal to its toughness.

editions.flavor: The faint smell of cloves, the rustling of the wind, and a paralyzing descent into an airless, fathomless tomb.

name: Death's Duet
text: Return two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Life has always been a dance. It is only fitting that death sing the tune.
Life has always been a dance. It is only fitting that death sing the tune.

name: Death's-Head Buzzard
text:
Flying
When Death's-Head Buzzard dies, all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Infested with vermin, ever hungering, dropping from night's sky.
Infested with vermin, ever hungering, dropping from night's sky.

name: Death Spark
text:
Death Spark deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Death Spark is in your graveyard with a creature card directly above it, you may pay {1}. If you do, return Death Spark to your hand.

name: Death Speakers
text: Protection from black

editions.flavor:
"Such innocent little birds. They sing a sweet song, sitting on their fragile branch."
—Grandmother Sengir

"Such innocent little birds. They sing a sweet song, sitting on their fragile branch."
—Grandmother Sengir

"The dead may be beyond the law, but speaking the wisdom of the dead will afford no protection!"
—Calmont, Aysen bureaucrat

name: Deathspore Thallid
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Deathspore Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Deathspore Thallid: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Sacrifice a Saproling: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

name: Death's Presence
text: Whenever a creature you control dies, put X +1/+1 counters on target creature you control, where X is the power of the creature that died.

editions.flavor:
"We traffic in flesh, not souls. Still, it's a shame to let anything go to waste."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

name: Death's Shadow
text: Death's Shadow gets -X/-X, where X is your life total.

editions.flavor: The shadow of the candle looms tall even as its light grows dim.
The shadow of the candle looms tall even as its light grows dim.

name: Death Stroke
text: Destroy target tapped creature.

editions.flavor: For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home. As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.
For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home. As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.
For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home, As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.

name: Death Ward
text: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor:
"Sometimes, a soul is not ready to complete its journey to the next world."
—Halvor Arenson,
Kjeldoran Priest

name: Death Watch
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, its controller loses life equal to its power and you gain life equal to its toughness.

editions.flavor:
"Watch death wait / Wait, death, watch / Steal breath swiftly / but steal life slowly."
—Suq'Ata dirge

name: Death Wind
text: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"I am a dragonslayer for Lord Silumgar. There is no dragon save him whom I fear."
—Xathi the Infallible
Leukin stared at the smoldering angel feathers. "Run!" he screamed to his patrol. "We don't stand a chance!"
Leukin stared at the smoldering angel feathers. "Run!" he screamed to his patrol. "We don't stand a chance!"

name: Death Wish
text: You may choose a card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand. You lose half your life, rounded up. Exile Death Wish.

editions.flavor: He wished for power, but not for the longevity to abuse it.

name: Debilitating Injury
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.

editions.flavor: Weakness exists within all who are not dragons.

"If weakness does not exist within the Temur then we shall force it upon them."
—Sidisi, khan of the Sultai

name: Debt of Loyalty
text: Regenerate target creature. You gain control of that creature if it regenerates this way.

editions.flavor: "I killed him because I had to," Starke lied to Gerrard. "But now I pledge my loyalty to you."

name: Debtors' Knell
text:
({W/B} can be paid with either {W} or {B}.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor: One moment, conscious only of a sense of repose. The next moment, hearing the trudge of his own footsteps. He sighed and squinted into the glare ahead.

name: Debtor's Pulpit
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Tap target creature."

editions.flavor:
"You may not be able to pay. But you can still kneel."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

name: Debt to the Deathless
text: Each opponent loses two times X life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

editions.flavor: Some of Orzhov's cruelest collectors remember their debtors by taste alone.

name: Decaying Soil
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile a card from your graveyard.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Decaying Soil has "Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, return that card to your hand."

name: Deceiver Exarch
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Deceiver Exarch enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Untap target permanent you control.
• Tap target permanent an opponent controls.

name: Deceiver of Form
text:
({C} represents colorless mana.)
At the beginning of combat on your turn, reveal the top card of your library. If a creature card is revealed this way, you may have creatures you control other than Deceiver of Form become copies of that card until end of turn. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.

name: Deception
text: Target opponent discards two cards.

editions.flavor: Believing they wrote the forged letter that had been stolen from Zhou Yu, Cao Cao rashly executed his two best admirals for treason.

name: Decimate
text: Destroy target artifact, target creature, target enchantment, and target land.

editions.flavor: Anarchy comes in many forms: social, individual, Gruul . . .
Anarchy comes in many forms: social, individual, Gruul . . .

"Anyone can admire creation. Only a barbarian sees the beauty in demolition."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Decimator Beetle
text:
When Decimator Beetle enters the battlefield, put a -1/-1 counter on target creature you control.
Whenever Decimator Beetle attacks, remove a -1/-1 counter from target creature you control and put a -1/-1 counter on up to one target creature defending player controls.

name: Decimator of the Provinces
text:
Emerge {6}{G}{G}{G} (You may cast this spell by sacrificing a creature and paying the emerge cost reduced by that creature's converted mana cost.)
When you cast Decimator of the Provinces, creatures you control get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.
Trample, haste

name: Decimator Web
text: {4}, {T}: Target opponent loses 2 life, gets a poison counter, then puts the top six cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: Mycosynth grew unfettered beneath the black lacuna, metastasizing into a matrix of noxious energy.

name: Decision Paralysis
text: Tap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

editions.flavor:
"Eyes see only what is possible. A trained mind can explore the impossible."
—Kefnet, god of knowledge

name: Declaration in Stone
text: Exile target creature and all other creatures its controller controls with the same name as that creature. That player investigates for each nontoken creature exiled this way.

editions.flavor: The message was clear to Sorin—Nahiri had paid Markov Manor a visit.

name: Declaration of Naught
text:
As Declaration of Naught enters the battlefield, name a card.
{U}: Counter target spell with the chosen name.

editions.flavor: Every story, even a faerie tale, comes to an end.

name: Decoction Module
text:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you get {E} (an energy counter).
{4}, {T}: Return target creature you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Progress leads to inspiration.

name: Decommission
text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Revolt — If a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: "A key weakness in the design is its vulnerability to repeated, forceful blows."

name: Decompose
text: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Sheesh! How am I supposed to make a decent living around here?"
—Cabal grave robber

"Sheesh! How am I supposed to make a decent living around here?"
—Cabal grave robber

name: Decomposition
text:
Enchant black creature
Enchanted creature has "Cumulative upkeep—Pay 1 life." (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless he or she pays its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When enchanted creature dies, its controller loses 2 life.

name: Deconstruct
text: Destroy target artifact. Add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "Nothing in this world, not even magic, likes to be caged."

name: Decorated Griffin
text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Prevent the next 1 combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

editions.flavor: The awards and medals of polis-dwellers mean nothing to griffins, but they repay acts of generosity.

name: Decree of Annihilation
text:
Exile all artifacts, creatures, and lands from the battlefield, all cards from all graveyards, and all cards from all hands.
Cycling {5}{R}{R} ({5}{R}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Annihilation, destroy all lands.

name: Decree of Justice
text:
Create X 4/4 white Angel creature tokens with flying.
Cycling {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Justice, you may pay {X}. If you do, create X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.

name: Decree of Pain
text:
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.
Cycling {3}{B}{B} ({3}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Pain, all creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

name: Decree of Savagery
text:
Put four +1/+1 counters on each creature you control.
Cycling {4}{G}{G} ({4}{G}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Savagery, you may put four +1/+1 counters on target creature.

name: Decree of Silence
text:
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, counter that spell and put a depletion counter on Decree of Silence. If there are three or more depletion counters on Decree of Silence, sacrifice it.
Cycling {4}{U}{U} ({4}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Silence, you may counter target spell.

name: Dedicated Martyr
text: {W}, Sacrifice Dedicated Martyr: You gain 3 life.

editions.flavor:
"If he's so willing to suffer for his cause, then by all means, let us oblige him."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Deem Worthy
text:
Deem Worthy deals 7 damage to target creature.
Cycling {3}{R} ({3}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Deem Worthy, you may have it deal 2 damage to target creature.

name: Deep Analysis
text:
Target player draws two cards.
Flashback—{1}{U}, Pay 3 life. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: "No fact escapes me. Why do you think you can?"
"The specimen seems to be broken."
"The specimen seems to be broken."
"No fact escapes me. Why do you think you can?"
"The specimen seems to be broken."
"The specimen seems to be broken."

name: Deepcavern Imp
text:
Flying, haste
Echo—Discard a card. (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

name: Deepchannel Mentor
text: Blue creatures you control can't be blocked.

editions.flavor: The rivers can no longer provide safe passage for travelers and commerce. They serve only as highways for raiders and channels for blood and woe.

name: Deepfathom Skulker
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
{3}{C}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

name: Deepfire Elemental
text: {X}{X}{1}: Destroy target artifact or creature with converted mana cost X.

editions.flavor:
"There are deep, deep places in this world that have long burned hot with little regard for the whitening of the earth's thin skin."
—Sek'Kuar, Deathkeeper

"There are deep, deep places in this world that have long burned hot with little regard for the whitening of the earth's thin skin."
—Sek'Kuar, Deathkeeper

name: Deepglow Skate
text: When Deepglow Skate enters the battlefield, double the number of each kind of counter on any number of target permanents.

editions.flavor: Its graceful glide paints the ocean floor with strokes of luminescence.

name: Deep Reconnaissance
text:
Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
Flashback {4}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Deep-Sea Kraken
text:
Deep-Sea Kraken can't be blocked.
Suspend 9—{2}{U} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {2}{U} and exile it with nine time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, if Deep-Sea Kraken is suspended, remove a time counter from it.

editions.flavor: The rift remained open for days, sluicing ancient seawater. It closed only after the last great tentacle squirmed its way through.

name: Deep-Sea Serpent
text: Deep-Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

editions.flavor: Sailors fear the deep-sea serpent; others thank the gods it has no legs.

name: Deep-Sea Terror
text: Deep-Sea Terror can't attack unless there are seven or more cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: After stripping the sunken ships, it rises to the surface for another helping.

name: Deep-Slumber Titan
text:
Deep-Slumber Titan enters the battlefield tapped.
Deep-Slumber Titan doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever Deep-Slumber Titan is dealt damage, untap it.

editions.flavor: Do not disturb.

name: Deep Spawn
text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Deep Spawn unless you put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
{U}: Deep Spawn gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Deep Spawn. (A creature with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

name: Deeptread Merrow
text: {U}: Deeptread Merrow gains islandwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

editions.flavor: "My success at navigating the Dark Meanders irritates the Inkfathom school. They consider themselves peerless divers, but I try to remind them that they cannot own commodities like bravery and cunning."

name: Deep Water
text: {U}: Until end of turn, if you tap a land you control for mana, it produces {U} instead of any other type.

name: Deepwater Hypnotist
text: Inspired — Whenever Deepwater Hypnotist becomes untapped, target creature an opponent controls gets -3/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Watch the waves too long, and you may never look away."
—Meletian proverb

name: Deep Wood
text:
Cast Deep Wood only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.

name: Deepwood Drummer
text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: His drums echo Deepwood's heartbeat.

name: Deepwood Elder
text: {X}{G}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: X target lands become Forests until end of turn.

editions.flavor: They'd guarded the Henge so long that they were as attuned to the powerstones as they were to the trees.

name: Deepwood Ghoul
text: Pay 2 life: Regenerate Deepwood Ghoul.

editions.flavor: They feed on the living to stay undead.
They feed on the living to stay undead.

name: Deepwood Legate
text:
If an opponent controls a Forest and you control a Swamp, you may cast Deepwood Legate without paying its mana cost.
{B}: Deepwood Legate gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Deepwood Tantiv
text: Whenever Deepwood Tantiv becomes blocked, you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: A single tantiv is just as dangerous as a herd.

name: Deepwood Wolverine
text: Whenever Deepwood Wolverine becomes blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The jhovalls are depleting its food sources, the Mercadians are eroding its home, and you're wondering why it's angry?

name: Defang
text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.

editions.flavor: Once vampires are disarmed, they're given wooden swords and forced to assist in the training of Midnight Duelists.

name: Defeat
text: Destroy target creature with power 2 or less.

editions.flavor:
"Wars are decided one life at a time."
—Gvar Barzeel, Kolaghan warrior

name: Defender en-Vec
text:
Fading 4 (This creature enters the battlefield with four fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Defender en-Vec: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

name: Defender of Chaos
text:
Flash
Protection from white

editions.flavor: Some knights will not follow orders—only disorder.

name: Defender of Law
text:
Flash
Protection from red

editions.flavor: "It is not my place to question Radiant's rule. I exist to enforce her will."
